_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary


Facility:                 United Suppliers, Inc.
Facility Location:   Pierre, SD
Address:              Eldora, IA 50627
Contact:               John Butler
Phone:                  641-858-2341

1.     Facility Policy.
        
        The owners, management and employees of  United Suppliers, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Hughes County Commission, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2.     Facility Information.

        The pri,ary acctivity at this location is storage and blending of fertilizers for sale to Retail Agriculture Dealers and Farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received and blended into 10-34-00 fertilizer.  This blending operation is preformed by a Mobil T-Reactor.  The T-Reactor process is a method of producing fertilizer composed of nitrogen and phosphorous.  The Nitrogen is supplied to the process in the form of anhydrous ammonia.  Phosphorous is supplied as wet-process superphosphoric acid.  Water is the other raw material and is used to dilute the plant nutrients to stable, standard grages of commercial fertilizer.  The standard grades produced by this processare 10-34-00 and 11-37-00.  The maximum quantity of anhydrous ammonia on hand during the blending operation would be 160,000 pounds.

3.     Worst-Case Scenario and Alternate Release Scenario

        a.     The worst-case scenario would be the release of the total contents of a railroad tank car.  The maximum quantity released would be approximately 160,000 pounds.  The distance to the end point is approximately 1.22 mile.  Operating Procedures are in place which include administrative controls and mitigation measures to reduce the possibility of a release.

        b.     The alternate release scenario is a release from a

3-inch transfer hose conection.  The distance to the endpoint is approximately 0.78 mile.  Operating Procedures are in place which include administrative controls and mitigation measures to reduce the possibility of a release.

4.     Accidental Release Prevention Program

        The facility is in compliance with the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".   The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b).  The facility has in place Standard Safe Operating Procedures for T-Reactors Process which the employees have been trained to follow.

5.      Five-Year Accident History.

         There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor, to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations,  property damage, or environmental damage.

6.       Emergency Action Plan.

          The facility has:

          a.     A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

          b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know   
                  information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).
          
7.       Planned Changes to Improve Safety.
